body:
@tsungruihon hi, i just want to know if  **_Decoder stopped with 'max_decoder_steps_**  occur during training, should i stop the training and overcome the issue or just proceed until the final epoch ?

what would be the effect of this error to my model if i proceed the training anyway ?
@DrHaqkiem train it anyway. I'll be corrected after attention module starts to align.
@erogol can't wait to see your latest improvement on `TTS`.

@erogol okay thank you 👌 and anyway, i run for 50 .wav file with different duration (not more than 30 sec each). Malay audio.

I split the csv file with 90% training and 10% validation. 10 batch size and 1000 epoch.

I know its a very small dataset right? 

From your opinion, do you think the model will be okay in the end?

Is this the reason why i received "decoder stopped with..." message during training?
@DrHaqkiem It seems that your dataset is too small. Try `TTS` on at least 5 hr duration dataset.

@erogol It's strange that if two sentences in a batch, like `batch=[short_text, long_text]`,  the `short_text` may probably not synthesis correctly, and the `short_text`'s `stop_token` is squeezed in a very small range. But if synthesis this two sentences separately, two result sound correct.
@tsungruihon what is wrong with the short text exactly. Can you post alingment and stopnet plot as in benchmark notebook?

@tsungruihon are you sure these two runs set ```model.eval()```

It looks to me that one has prenet with dropout and the other not
@erogol i sure these two runs set `model.eval()`, i just changed the input, that's all. But the result seems different.
